website_summaries.verdict: Altra has modified the Torin and incorporated its IQ technology to provide runners real-time feedback of their running, making the Altra Torin IQ a “smart-shoe.” The Altra IQ technology along with the shoe’s cushioning and reflective upper gained positive feedback from the users. While others are satisfied with the overall performance of the shoe, there are still a few who are disappointed, especially those who have issues with the fit. Overall, the Altra Torin IQ is a must-try shoe for road running.
pros: A few users were impressed by the shoe’s midfoot and forefoot cushioning, emphasizing that the responsiveness was clearly felt
Several purchasers admired the informative statistics and real-time coaching delivered by the Altra IQ technology
Some of the satisfied users mentioned the notable 360° Reflective Upper which is very useful for night running
The Altra Torin IQ is a lightweight road shoe, said some runners
The shoe has a good-looking design, said a user
The width profiles of both the men and women’s versions were considered to be adherent to expectations
According to several users, the toe box was roomy enough for toe relaxation
cons: The Altra Torin IQ is an expensive shoe
Some disappointed wearers mentioned that they had difficulty connecting to the Altra App
A few consumers felt that the outsole lacks durability
it has no high-abrasion rubber to protect the cushioning
The forefoot section of this running shoe apparently creased quickly when subjected to the ordinary bending of the toes during toe-off, some people noted
Some purchasers claimed that the sole unit emitted a squeaking sound that caused some awkwardness during either a run or a leisurely stroll

customer_reviews.title: I generally like Altras. The bluetooth for these shoes is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I generally like Altras. The bluetooth for these shoes is a little slow to connect sometimes. I have found if you are also connecting bluetooth headphones, it helps to connect the shoes first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have it for about 4 months now. It worked well for some time. The clues to adjust your running form are weak, so it's difficult to correct your form unless you keep looking at your phone / app. Finally, the left shoe started just showing that I have been always landing on my toes, which is not true. Even when I intentionally land on the heels, it still shows toe landing. I contacted support, and they offered a replacement (within warranty), but they discontinued the Torin IQ model and have no other smart shoes. Therefore, it means they'd be sending you a much cheaper replacement. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro Sousa

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable shoes I’ve worn in decades.
customer_reviews.text: Altra Torin IQ and Torin 3.5 are unquestionably the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn. I’m 65, have Very high arches, supinate a lot, haven’t had proper shoes (zero drop, neutral, cushioned). Consequently, my feet have gone through some things, and, I can only wear zero drop, neutral, cushioned shoes. Altra Torin IQ are unquestionably one of the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn. In my case, Altras were on the order of life changing in terms of foot health and mobility. I hope for more wider footbed Altra zero drop, neutral shoes and boots with moderate to high cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: HEarle

customer_reviews.title: App won't sync.
customer_reviews.text: Will not sync with app. Shoes squeak when you walk. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sent this back before I tried it. The interface didn't seem worth it for the price
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is top notch.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is well made and extremely comfortable. I’m a constant user of Altra shoes and this is one my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: It was useful to read on reviews on this shoe commenting it ...
customer_reviews.text: It was useful to read on reviews on this shoe commenting it tends to be a snug fit, so i ordered them half a size larger than I normal do and so they fit nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Henkel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes
customer_reviews.text: Use these for work. Crazy comfortable. Bought another pair for pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Go up 1/2 size!
customer_reviews.text: They run 1/2 size small. I usually wear 8.5 but my toes were all the way to the end. Sent them back for a size 9... Other than that, very excited to lay down some miles in these!
customer_reviews.author: Tina S.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, but Altra Olympus is the best running shoe ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: reviews indicated it was a small fitting shoe and recommended ordering half size larger
customer_reviews.text: reviews indicated it was a small fitting shoe and recommended ordering half size larger. I did just that and my husband says they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ledwick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: On time delivery and excellent fit - helped me to complete my 100km run smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Dhana D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The shoe gets a crease in the front middle of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: frances

customer_reviews.title: Only had these a few days so I can't do ...
customer_reviews.text: Only had these a few days so I can't do a thorough review yet. They run very small and I didn't see a 13.5 size so I had to take the insoles out and loosen the laces. My toes barely brush the front and top from time to time. We will see how they pan out. I'll probably get a size bigger or a different shoe/company (that fits better) next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size up.
customer_reviews.text: These run small for me. I go through at least 8 pairs of shoes per year. Multiply that by 30 years and it's a lot of shoes. My Altras are one full size bigger than any other shoe I've worn. This may not be the case with smaller sizes. I wear a 13 normally, and a 14 in Altra shoes. If you're not used to zero drop shoes, you'll want to ease into these. Your lower calves and possibly achilles may scream at you for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lance L. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great seller but bad shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bad shoes. I used 5 times and the right shoes didn't work and the App didn't connect with it anymore. Very disappointed! The seller was great and precise.
customer_reviews.author: Mickd70

customer_reviews.title: No longer supported in the iFit app
customer_reviews.text: Altra shoes are generally great, but don't buy this model--the iFit app won't pair, and appears not to support the shoes anymore. I did use the app successfully on a couple of runs two years ago, but it doesn't work anymore. The shoes pair with my phone's bluetooth instantly, but they won't connect to the app. The IQ line is no longer sold by Altra and appears to have been abandoned after Altra was acquired by VF Corporation.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: One shoe connects the other doesn't.  Battery contact broke.  AWFUL QUALITY OF ELECTRONICS
customer_reviews.text: Take a nice shoe and put electronics that a 5 year old put together. Dry solder joints snapped when you put in a new battery - BECAUSE the one supplied were already DEAD !!! AWFUL AWFUL example of making a smartshoe !!! When they did work, one shoe would connect, the other would not - and the app endlessly tries to link to the 'lost shoe'. No basic robustness testing was done - as these lasted 5 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes, but: - breathable is limited; - treadmill adhesion of the sole is also limited; - low abrasion resistance of the sole; - after 200 km (left) shoe stop connecting to the Altra app!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: ALTRA Men's Torin Iq Road Running Shoe
product_meta.description: We've taken the Torin, our best-selling road shoe, and added IQ technology to provide you with live feedback on foot strike, cadence, impact rate and contact time. The Torin IQ's razor-thin footbed sensors provide onboard coaching to help you improve your technique and form on-the-run. The updated reflective upper and asymmetrical lacing allow you to enjoy your run in comfort and safety. This neutral workhorse has a 28 mm stack height and a smooth, forgiving, plush ride thanks to the responsive A-Bound compound in the midsole. Let your foot biomechanics work freely with the combination of the toe-wiggling FootShape toe box and the natural foot positioning allowed by the fully cushioned ZeroDrop platform.
feature_bullets: DESIGNED TO IMPROVE: Running Form and Technique; Natural Foot Positioning, Toe Splay, Comfort.
PLATFORM: Fully cushioned Zero Drop platform and FootShape toe box. CUSHIONING: Medium. STACK HEIGHT: 28mm. LAST: PFS2-M.
MIDSOLE: FlexSensor, Quad Accelerometers, Ultralight EVA with A-Bound. OUTSOLE: FootPod Outsole. INSOLE: 6mm Contour Footbed. UPPER: 360° Reflective Upper.
OTHER FEATURES: Natural Ride System; BLE Wireless Communication; Strike Zone Tracking; Impact Force Measurement; Audible Running Cues; Stat Tracking; Post Run Summary.
IDEAL USES: Running, Walking, Fitness. WEIGHT: 9.3oz/264g.
